intro: Viburnum lantana var. grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leaved honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically 4–8 inches long and have a glossy green upper surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adaptable to a variety of soil types.
